title: Font Id "Sheffield University fonts"
content:
Does anyone know what typeface these custom fonts are based on?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sheffield_3667.png)

 [‹ FONT I.D. FUN! :)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47045 "Go to previous forum topic") [G.I Joe Movie Font - seen it before, can't remember ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47040 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Capnhud

comments.content:
the stephenson typeface looks a lot like “New Century Schoolbook” [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/new-century-schoolbook/)

as for the blake typeface, man, I know I have seen something similar to that before...I try and come up with it

<cite> I know I have seen something similar to that before...</cite>

[Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Maple&x=0&y=0)

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here
‘Blake typeface’ looks a lot like Bureau Grotesque, too.

Stephenson Blake were a Sheffield company, so it does make sense.

I’ve got some brand information about this at work, but I can’t access my machine ’til the morning. I seem to recall it does say something about the fonts, I’ll check.

<cite>I’ve got some brand information about this at work, but I can’t access my machine ’til the morning. I seem to recall it does say something about the fonts, I’ll check.</cite>

I would appreciate that.

Sigma appears to be very very close based on the image I provided. However when I compare the [Sheffield letter layout pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026/http:/www.sheffield.ac.uk/content/1/c6/03/13/21/Letter_layout.pdf) to Maple it appears to be very similar to that unless I am mistaken, but the Sheffield letter layout indicates that the font is called Blake, but does not seem to resemble any of the Stephenson Blake fonts that I have seen.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

The memory plays tricks.

It seems what I had for this came from [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905085026/http:/www.shef.ac.uk/marcoms/visualid/elements/fonts.html), which, judging by the image in your first post, looks like a page you’ve already found.

Sorry I couldn’t offer more help.

Thanks for looking and all the suggestions from everyone.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

These were written up in an Eye magazine, can’t remember which issue sorry. Also had Tankard’s Granby I think.

—K
